content.description: Start low on the nice flat rails and head right up the arete to the highest point.  It is sort of a one and half star route.  This has cool rock, decent movement at the start, but the end is kind of a mess.
content.location: This ascends the opposite arete from Glitter Dike.

content.description:
This is thin, thin smearing up a surprisingly slick face using the rounded right arete (mostly for moral support). There is little in the way of holds anywhere on this thing, but the crux is probably midway. This has perfect rock. It is one of the best pure slab problems on Cape Ann.  

 Eat that wonton soup!
content.protection: Pads. The landing is great, but multiple pads are welcome given the cruxy nature of the climbing near the top and the fact that you have to chuck yourself off.
content.location: Located on the largest boulder, this climbs the slabby face left of the face that contains Modern Warfare.

content.description:
Sit start at twin cracks underneath the tree on the short side of this boulder.  Pull up and head right topping out where Elephant in the Room tops out.   

  It is sort of a one and half star route.
content.location: This is on the big Granola Boulder and left of Elephant in the Room.

content.description:
This essentially a shorter, easier variation of problem The American Dream, V6, that avoids the desperate starting holds of the later route. 

  Sit start on the left corner reaching up with your right hand onto the vertical rail, pull up, traverse the arete, and top out.   This is a good route at the grade but not as full value as its namesake.
content.location: On the smaller granola boulder, this starts near the left corner of the obvious, overhanging face with the sloping rails (on which the American Dream start).

content.description: Stack a pad and stand start the beautiful face/arête. Start with right hand on rounded arête and left on anything with friction. Stand up on a high right smear. Move up, and top out. This is a cool new addition.
content.location: On the larger Granola Boulder, start roughly between the problems Law Abiding Citizen and Pool of Tears.

content.description: On the smaller Granola Boulder, stand start the right arête about 8-10 feet right of the problem The American Dream. Move up, traverse left to the peak, and top out.
content.location: This is the steep, right arete on the smaller boulder.

content.description: Stand start the steep slab on the larger Granola Boulder with left hand on the rounded arête and right hand on anything you can grab. Balance up and right to a tiny, razor-sized, right hand sidepull. Move straight up, and top out.
content.location: Start about 4-5 feet left of the problem Wonton Soup.

content.description: Sit start on thin holds, move up on thin crimps to a crux move to the lip, and top out. Use the flat rock pedestal for feet.
content.location: It is on the backside of the smaller boulder about 8-10 feet left of the problem The American Dream.

content.description: Modern Warfare is a serious slab encounter. Stand start the steep slab with a high left hand tiny crimp gaston and right hand on any bump you can find.Power up with hardly any feet and minimal handholds. The line goes straight up without using the right arête. This is a great send for any slab afectionario. Second ascent by strong John Chippa.
content.location: This ascends the steep slab on the bigger boulder.

content.description: Sit start with right crimp and left hand on the arête. Move up and left to an easy finish.
content.location: This is on the larger Granola Boulder about 6-8 feet right of the problem Knowledge is Power.

content.description:
Sit start reaching up to ok slopers and move up and over.  It is not that tall, but it is powerful.  This is a good little problem.    

  I had to take my shirt off to get the send.
content.location:
This is located on long low oval shaped boulder approximately 150 yards S/SE of the main Granola Boulders.  It's also near the Glitter Dike Boulder.   

  It starts down low beneath between two rock pedestals on the face that sort of faces Glitter Dike.  The route may not be that obvious at first.

content.description: Stand start with the good rail and crap feet, dyno straight up to the right hand sloper, and top out. The grade range of V4-5 accounts for climber height/reach.
content.location: This is on the backside of the larger Granola Boulder.

content.description: Stand start and make a slopey lip traverse right to top out.
content.location: On the larger Granola Boulder, start a few feet right of the tree and about 6-8 feet left of the problem Absolute Zero.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched in the finger crack. Make a hard move right to the arete, and top out on jugs.
content.location: On the bigger boulder, this is the dead obvious steep finger crack.

content.description: Sit start, follow a nice, rising, left-slanting arete to the highpoint, and topout.  It is a nice climb at the grade.
content.protection: Pads, but it has a good landing.
content.location: This located on a boulder in a small group approximately 300 yards southeast of the two main boulders.  This is the climbs the nicely cut, gently rising arete.

content.description: Crouch start, traverse the good rail left, throw a heel, crank to a sloper, and top out.
content.location: This is on the backside of the bigger boulder.

content.description: Start sitting the steep left face about 5-6 feet right of a tree with hands on two decent flat holds on the face. Move left into a series of gastons and then up.Traverse the arête right to top out.
content.location: This is on the smaller boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the larger Granola Boulder. Start about 8-10 feet left of the problem Modern Warfare with your left hand on the blunt, rounded arête and right hand on a crimp and lousy feet. Climb straight up.
content.location: This is on the larger Granola Boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched in vertical crack as for the problem Knowledge is Power. Bump your right hand up higher in the crack, and fire your left hand to the slopey arête. Move up and top out.
content.location: This is on the larger Granola Boulder.

content.description: These are two main blocks about 50 feet apart with a few problems with potential for more problems on nearby boulders.
